questions.question: What is the primary importance of effective communication according to the Company’s policy?
options: To enhance crew morale and comfort
To ensure safe and efficient ship management at all levels
To promote social interaction between vessels
To comply with commercial reporting requirements only
questions.answer: To ensure safe and efficient ship management at all levels
questions.explanation: Effective communication is essential for maintaining both safety and operational efficiency across all Company and vessel activities.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the communication procedures described in this chapter?
options: To define internal email usage limits
To provide standardized procedures and precautions for all types of ship and shore communications
To establish social media guidelines for the Company
To regulate internet access onboard
questions.answer: To provide standardized procedures and precautions for all types of ship and shore communications
questions.explanation: The chapter outlines uniform procedures for routine, emergency, and safety-related communication to ensure consistency and compliance.

questions.question: Which of the following types of communication is NOT included within the scope of this chapter?
options: Routine communications between Company and managed ships
Distress, Urgency, and Safety communications
Ship reporting systems and requirements
Personal communications between crew members and their families
questions.answer: Personal communications between crew members and their families
questions.explanation: The policy addresses operational, safety, and regulatory communication, excluding private or personal exchanges.

questions.question: According to the Company’s communication policy, who must ensure the confidentiality of messages?
options: Only the Master
All personnel involved in preparing or handling incoming and outgoing messages
The Designated Person Ashore only
Only radio operators
questions.answer: All personnel involved in preparing or handling incoming and outgoing messages
questions.explanation: Every person handling Company communication has a duty to safeguard confidentiality in accordance with policy and regulations.

questions.question: Which of the following topics are explicitly included in the communication procedures?
options: Radio watchkeeping, radio equipment maintenance, and confidentiality of communications
Crew disciplinary communication and welfare programs
Marketing communication and public relations
Commercial correspondence with charterers only
questions.answer: Radio watchkeeping, radio equipment maintenance, and confidentiality of communications
questions.explanation: The scope includes both operational communications and technical maintenance of radio systems to ensure readiness and compliance.

questions.question: Why does the Company include reporting requirements for ships carrying dangerous or polluting goods in its communication procedures?
options: To comply with international regulations and ensure immediate information flow in case of danger or pollution risk
To promote transparency in cargo trading
To reduce the need for cargo documentation
To meet charterers’ commercial information demands
questions.answer: To comply with international regulations and ensure immediate information flow in case of danger or pollution risk
questions.explanation: Timely reporting of dangerous or polluting goods enhances regulatory compliance and environmental protection.

questions.question: What is one of the safety-related functions emphasized under the Company’s communication policy?
options: Routine crew messaging via satellite phones
Distress, Urgency, and Safety communications as required by international conventions
Daily shipboard announcements and briefings
Social updates from shore management
questions.answer: Distress, Urgency, and Safety communications as required by international conventions
questions.explanation: The SMS requires adherence to international protocols for distress, urgency, and safety messages as part of GMDSS compliance.
